subject: p10933609
History: Left upper extremity pain after surgery one month prior, history of aspiration pneumonia, evaluate for cardiopulmonary disease or infiltrate.
Findings: Single frontal radiograph of the chest was performed and reveals no acute cardiopulmonary process. The cardiomediastinal and pleural structures are unremarkable. There is scarring in the upper lungs with superior traction of the hila. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Heart size is normal. Surgical hardware is seen at the right glenohumeral joint and are seen within the abdomen with cardiophrenic angle may represent a small left pleural effusion as was previously seen approximately one month prior.
